intro: Dodecatheon meadia var. genuinum, commonly known as the showy peacock flower, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along streambanks. The flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
